definition: parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: This is the processor affinity mask.
When apple varieties were grafted to M. hupehensis, they showed good affinity. It is, therefore, recommended as a good rootstock for apple trees.
sentences.chinese: 嫁接苹果品种亲和性好，是一个良好的苹果砧木。

sentences.english: The product has good film-forming, penetrating properties and affinity to fiber.
sentences.chinese: 产品成膜性好，渗透性及亲和性较好，用途广。

sentences.english: The graft compatibility was small between Camellia oleifera and Camellia yuhsienensis h. h. hu.
sentences.chinese: 普通油茶和攸县油茶嫁接亲和性差异不大。

sentences.english: The objectivity relation which between the human and water, decide the human have affinity to water.
sentences.chinese: 人与自然的对象性关系，决定了人对于水的亲和性。

sentences.english: Bud pollination was regarded as one of the effective method to overcome the intergeneric cross incompatibility in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 蕾期授粉是克服属间杂交不亲和性的有效方法。

definition: agglutinative (in linguistics, a characteristic of Altaic languages)
(personal) warmth/approachability/accessibility/(in a product) user friendliness/(chemistry) affinity
